snippet: New passenger car registrations, a proxy for sales, rose 4.6 percent, but the number of vehicles sold was still very poor by historical standards, an industry group said.
abstract: European Automobile Manufacturers Association reports that European car market expanded for eighth consecutive month, continuing its climb from lows reached in 2013; new passenger car registrations rose 4.6 percent, but number of vehicles sold was still very poor by historical standards.
lead_paragraph: New passenger car registrations, a proxy for sales, rose 4.6 percent, but the number of vehicles sold was still very poor by historical standards, an industry group said.

headline.main: Europe’s Auto Market Continues to Recover at Slow Pace
headline.print_headline: Auto Market in Europe Continues to Expand
